column4: hey, i've just done a dist-upgrade to breezy today and i'm getting a lot of bus errors. anyone else seen this?
that was a very bad idea.
mm. i gathered. whats the issue, is there a fix?
probably some wrong library dependency. If you know 'aptitude' well you can probably fix it fairly easily.
try 'apt-get check' and/or look if there are some bad things with 'synaptic'
mm. my package selection looks sane
then some of those libraries or apps are broken...
which exact problems do you get?
mm. well for a start the postinst for libgtk2.0-bin is failing as i get a bus error in /usr/bin/gdk-pixbuf-query-loaders
afaict all gtk apps are bus-erroring :S
almost surely a bug in the package. You can hardly do anything for it, except to wait for a fixed package.
I would suggest looking at the bug/issue database as almost surely this has been reported.
unlikely -- or else it is just you that's jinxed.
mm. i know. could be a transitional error just today
sort of unlikely, but yes, it is possible.
what you could do, if you knew how all these things work, is to hack the libgtk posting script, this would allow libgtk to install, and this may fix the rest
btw i am the debian libgnomeprint maint. broken packages i can cope with, random bus errors are a bit on teh weird side tho..
